H0.text: 1 year is about how long it takes Earth to make a complete revolution around the Sun.

H1.text: 1 week is about the time it takes Earth to complete one revolution around the Sun.

H2.text: 1 day is about how long it takes Earth to make a complete revolution around the Sun.

H3.text: 1 hour is the approximate time it takes Earth to complete a full revolution around the Sun.

A4.text: Earth orbits the Sun every 365.2564 mean solar days, or one sidereal year.

A5.text: Earth's rotation period relative to the Sun—its mean solar day—is 86,400 seconds of mean solar time (86,400.0025 SI seconds).
